tweets.text:
As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature üåø https://t.co/8WXeqhXwOQ

@TraceyMaryHart @gmasselink @SW_EEP @Nick_Ely @EnvAgencySW Oh yes, and they were fine this time. What is unusual is that this point (about the most vulnerable on the entire scheme) was nearly overtopped by a relatively small tide and high pressure (hence the gates being open.) Tide didn‚Äôt get close to the defences in other areas.

.@gmasselink @SW_EEP @Nick_Ely @EnvAgencySW possibly the world‚Äôs most boring video but the sea must briefly have overtopped the base of the open flood defences in Shaldon over Fri/Sat mornings‚Äô high tides. Some long period waves entering through mouth of the Teign? https://t.co/FqW0RLk7j4

tweets.text: Scandalous that @Ruralpay is failing to fine those farmers breaking the farming rules for water but penalizing big time farmers who do something that's actually benefiting the environment. Make no mistake this is corruption. @JanetHughes @BenGoldsmith https://t.co/A91CFeouOZ https://t.co/iBCnRkGLkb

Some of the Farming Rules for Water are virtually unenforceable and @EnvAgency lacks the capacity to monitor compliance. The story here is the low number of recorded breaches when our rivers are in such a dire state. https://t.co/X2jjMCN4la

Climate change, population growth and drought all put pressure on #water supplies üíß

We're launching a consultation on our updated map of the areas of the country where this pressure could be greatest.

Help us safeguard our future water supplies: https://t.co/QiNHGViNau https://t.co/QVOR9eKIlC

tweets.text:
Our Field Team have been out and about in North Lancashire doing maintenance activities at Wade Brook #Leyland 

They have been busy opening water course channels by doing tree work, cutting vegetation back and taking out big blockages to reduce the threat of #flood risk. https://t.co/QRjOwwI9Qo

Removal of waste is included as standard.We guarantee the waste taken from your property won‚Äôt be dumped in the countryside.We are registered with the @EnvAgency & have an upper tier waste license so you can rest assure anything taken away with us will be disposed of responsibly. https://t.co/0XezuRWlLq

Some good news today as a project with @OfficialUoM @moorsforfuture @ProtectNFM to test natural flood risk management in #Stalybridge is complete! 

It aims to capture carbon, restore damaged peatland & slow the flow of #flood water

Take a look üëâ https://t.co/oNXOyfqxmK
